comments.body: I think you want to run `execute_notebook` on just the single `input_nb` & `output_nb`, instead of iterating over all inlets & outlets. It will fail if you happen to add more inlets/outlets, which are not notebooks, and the notebooks are provided as a string (i.e. single item) anyways.

Inlets can be multiple actually and you are not required to set input/output. I’m a little in doubt how to tackle this without affecting parallelism of airflow.

I should probably make Notebook derive from File and accept all File derivatives and skip the ones it doesn’t know about or fail (unsure)
@BasPH I will fix the issue with inlets filtering in a separate PR. This can be fixed in the decorator with an extension of the lineage pattern.
not sure if there is any consensus on putting which operator where, but won't this belongs to contrib section?
I think the idea is to drop the contrib section somewhere close in the future.
